alert.note: Alert for City of Harrisonburg; Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 09 at 12:51AM EDT until June 09 at 4:15AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Virginia and eastern West Virginia, including the following counties: in Virginia, City of Harrisonburg, Page, Rockingham and Shenandoah. In eastern West Virginia, Grant, Hardy and Pendleton. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1250 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harrisonburg... Franklin... Luray... Broadway... Timberville... Shenandoah... Mount Jackson... Stanley... Brandywine... Basye-Bryce Mountain... Upper Tract... New Market... Basye... Edinburg... Fulks Run... Tunis... Yankeetown... Cherry Grove... Singers Glen... Sparkling Springs... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: City of Harrisonburg; Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah
